skill.name: web-build-deploy
skill.description: Building and deploying React web applications. Use when configuring builds, deploying to Vercel/Netlify, setting up CI/CD, Docker, or managing environments.
skill.summary: Building and deploying React web applications. Use when configuring builds, deploying to Vercel/Netl...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no external commands, or environment variable access. Contains only example code snippets for deployment workflows.

content.user_title: Deploy React Apps to Vercel, Netlify, and Docker
content.value_statement: Need to deploy a React application but unsure about the best platform and configuration? This skill provides ready-to-use deployment patterns for Vercel, Netlify, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines with security best practices included.
actual_capabilities: Deploy React apps to Vercel with vercel.json configuration
Deploy React apps to Netlify with netlify.toml configuration
Build Docker containers with multi-stage Dockerfile
Set up environment variables for build tools
Implement security headers and caching strategies
limitations: Does not execute deployment commands automatically
Does not create or modify project files
Does not access cloud provider credentials
Requires manual execution of example commands

use_cases.title: Deploy first React app
use_cases.description: Choose platform, configure build, and deploy React application with proper security headers

use_cases.title: Set up CI/CD pipeline
use_cases.description: Configure GitHub Actions workflow with automated testing and deployment to production

use_cases.title: Containerize React app
use_cases.description: Create optimized Docker image with multi-stage build and nginx serving

prompt_templates.title: Basic Vercel deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I deploy my React app to Vercel? Show me the vercel.json configuration with security headers.

prompt_templates.title: Netlify deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the commands to deploy to Netlify? Include the netlify.toml configuration file.

prompt_templates.title: Docker production
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me a production-ready Dockerfile for my React app with multi-stage build and nginx.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that builds, tests, and deploys to Vercel on push to main branch.

output_examples.input: How do I deploy my Vite React app to Vercel?
output: Use `npm i -g vercel` to install CLI
Create vercel.json with buildCommand and outputDirectory
Set environment variables with `vercel env add`

best_practices: Always configure security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options) in deployment config
Use environment variables with proper prefixes (VITE_, NEXT_PUBLIC_) for client-side access
Enable caching for static assets to improve performance
anti_patterns: Committing sensitive credentials to version control
Using environment variable names without proper prefixes for client-side access
Deploying without health check endpoints or error tracking

faq.question: Which platform should I choose for my React app?
faq.answer: Vercel offers best integration for Next.js. Netlify works well for any static site. Choose based on your framework and existing tooling.

faq.question: What environment variables do I need for build?
faq.answer: Use VITE_ prefix for Vite apps, NEXT_PUBLIC_ for Next.js. Server-only variables should not have these prefixes.

faq.question: How do I configure SPA routing on production?
faq.answer: Configure server fallback to index.html for all routes. Both Vercel and Netlify support this via rewrites configuration.

faq.question: Is my code safe when deploying?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation examples. You execute deployment commands yourself. Never commit secrets to version control.

faq.question: Build fails on CI but works locally?
faq.answer: Check Node version matches local environment. Clear CI cache and verify environment variables are set in CI secrets.

faq.question: How is this different from other deployment tools?
faq.answer: This is a reference guide, not an execution tool. It shows configuration patterns and commands for manual or scripted deployment.
